The next morning, Hank woke and stretched out the sleep from his limbs. Scratching at his soft gut, he couldn't remember the last time he'd slept so... heavily! After his enormous lunch, he'd managed to hold off any lingering hunger-pangs until dinner with the others, where he'd actually managed to kill several conversations with his enthusiastic glutting of Jean's amazing beef stew and mashed potatoes. By the time he'd finished off his fifth helping, quite a few of his friends were openly staring, their own first servings forgotten. After a satisfied but stifled belch, Hank left the table visibly thicker around the middle than when he'd sat down, belly pushing down against his waistband, sides and rump bulging under the blue fur. But even that hadn't completely sated him, and just a few hours later he'd snuck back to the kitchen for a midnight snack. The empty gallon of ice cream lay on his floor, now, and he stooped down to pick it up, barely registering how his stomach rolled over his waistband with added weight.

He regarded himself in his full-length mirror for a bit as he brushed out his fur, and smiled. He felt... good! It was difficult to explain why, even as the brush passed over his soft blue gut. Maybe he'd had a particularly nice dream? He vaguely recalled something about a gingerbread house, and a kindly old woman... or maybe it had been about discovering the world's largest Twinkie? Either way, he felt eager to start the day, and the only way to do that was with a hearty breakfast! Perhaps Kitty would be making waffles again...

---


As the days went on, each meal Hank ate was just as large, if not larger, than the last. Something deep inside him had decided it could not be satisfied until his belly was achingly full, and so he stuffed himself on three or four large meals a day, and even though he would snack in between and sneak a large midnight morsel, he still felt hungry. The growling of his stomach distracted him from his work, until most of his time in the lab was spent indulging on his hidden stockpile of Twinkies while making excuses about why he'd have to skip the latest training session, or else daydreaming about his next meal. It was only every now and then during an increasingly rare moment of sated lucidity that he recognized how ridiculously tight his clothes were getting, how laughably large his stomach was growing, our how embarassingly snug his chair was becoming. And along with these alarming realizations, he would again grow concerned about Dukes' oddly docile captivity down in the holding cells. The Brotherhood hadn't even attempted a rescue as far as he knew. Maybe once the Professor returned from his visit to the Shi-ar Empire, they would get some real answers... but these concerns would always quickly pass as soon as his stomach growled again, and he'd return once more to his ever greater indulgences.

---


And so it was after a very full week of glutting on a truly epic scale that Hank found himself lumbering to the kitchen for his next meal. His clothes had finally decided that they were much too small (likely just a mishap with the washing machine) and he was forced to wear his snug modesty briefs, with his labcoat pulling tight over his thick arms and across his broad backside. His bared belly bounced and wobbled with every lumbering step, his gait dangerously close to becoming an outright waddle, causing his softened chest and double chin to jiggle a bit as well. His teammates stepped aside, stunned by how large Hank had become in just a week. Was this some sort of new mutation? He certainly didn't seem concerned about it... How could he not notice how he'd practically doubled his weight in so little time?

"You ain't the only one," Logan laughed, drumming his belly pointedly. "I've been eatin' like a hog at a trough, lately."

"Oh, I hardly think you're big enough to be a hog," Hank said slyly, leaning over (with some difficulty, his stretched stomach protesting the action) and placing a hand on Logan's belly, gently pressing in and testing for give. He found a little, but only a little. "If anything you're just a piglet, and a far too skinny one at that."

"A piglet, huh?" Logan asked, reaching one hand under his belly and surreptitiously unbuttoning his jeans. That done he leaned over, grunting as his strained sides groaned at the effort, and poked a hand at Hank's own gut, which had actually popped one of his lab coat buttons as he leaned over. "That what you are, bub? A piglet?"

"Oh, no, friend," Hank said, leaning back and caressing his bulging gut with one large hand. "I'm afraid I'm a Beast." The two laughed at the joke, grimacing slightly as their overstuffed bellies protested the motion.

"A Beast, huh," Logan said once he'd stopped laughing. "Well, what if this piglet wants to be a Beast, too? What would you suggest?"

"I would suggest," Hank said, "that the piglet go back to the table for more dinner. He's got a lot more fattening up to do if he wants to be like his beastly friend."

"And would his friend be willing to help with that?" Logan asked in a low, serious voice.

"Most assuredly," Hank replied, in the same tone. Logan grinned and rose to his feet, pressing one hand on his belly, testing for space.

"Well, then, back to the trough for piglet!"

Hank smiled as Logan walked away, enjoying the fullness of his belly. He was surprised at how easily he had brushed off the realization of his weight gain, but he supposed Logan's new heft had helped. Certainly his assertions as to Logan's "skin and bones" and "thinner by the moment" comments were as far from the mark as possible, and yet there had been something...exciting about encouraging his friend to eat, something mesmerizing in seeing that round belly expand further as Logan greedily stuffed it with food. And Logan's hog comment, and his own terms of piglet and beast for them both...and Logan's remark about helping him fatten up...he hadn't been this excited in a long time.

Logan returned from the food bar laden down with a full five plates, each piled as high as possible. "My, my," Hank commented, "Piglet's certainly ambitious, isn't he?"

Logan grinned as he sat down and immediately stuffed a roll dripping in butter into his mouth, chewing and swallowing as though literally starving. "Does Beast have a problem with that?"

"Most certainly not," Hank said, eyes riveted as his new Piglet crammed a forkful of mashed potatoes into his mouth, eyes slowly moving down to his friends bulging belly just in time to see a button fly off into space. He smiled as Logan continued to stuff himself. "Piglets a growing boy, after all."

"Oink, oink." Logan said as he chewed and swallowed, ignoring how achingly full his stomach was as he continued to eat.

1211112112111.content:
Hank leaned back in his chair, watching intently as his Piglet continued to gorge. Every so he would give his own overstuffed belly an absentminded rub as it gurgled and groaned, working to digest its heavy load. He had a vague notion that his role as Beast would be best served by increasing that load, but there'd be time for that later. Right now was about Logan, his little Piglet.

"Oh, man," his Piglet groaned, pausing in his eating and leaning back, massaging his bulging sides, his belly hard like a rock in his lap. Two of his five plates had been cleared, but there were three more to go. "I'm so fuckin' full. I think I'm gonna pop..."

Hank smiled and switched to the other side of the table, his gut heavy in front of him as he sat down and placed a hand on Logan's belly, caressing gently. "Come now, Piglet," Logan's breath hitched slightly at the endearment, "surely you can fit in a little more. Isn't your tummy begging for it?" His Piglet nodded, still groaning, his belly heavy with food. Hank smiled, using his claws to lightly scritch at Logan's swollen sides.

"You're so thin, Piglet," he said in an undertone. "Why, if you took that shirt off, I bet I could count your ribs." Most unlikely, actually; Logan's chest was beefier than ever, the powerful muscle padded with a light covering of fat.

"And your face...why, it's positively sunken!" In point of fact, Logan's face had filled out a little. Not overmuch; he still possessed his rugged attractiveness, but his jaw was softer, the faintest sign of a double chin appearing.

"But you know what concerns me most, Piglet?" Logan shook his head and Hank smiled, holding a roll up to Logan's mouth. His Piglet obediently opened up and took it whole, chewing slowly, eyes closed and head tilted back.

"What concerns me most, my little Piglet," Hank continued, "is your poor, poor tummy. It's so small, so underfed."

The tummy in question was currently holding enough food for four, and had grown remarkably plump in recent days. Not so plump as his own belly, of course, but he was the Beast, wasn't he? And it was his job to encourage his Piglet.

"Can you eat a little more for me, Piglet? Can you do that? Can you eat the way a fat little piggy should?" Logan gave another moan, but then nodded, opening his eyes and leaning forward, placing a large bite of chicken in his mouth. "Good Piggy," Hank said, and Logan gave him a grin as he chewed and swallowed.

"Oink, oink!"

Hank gave a hearty laugh before handing his Piglet another roll.

The meal continued in this vain for another thirty minutes. Every so often his Logan would stop eating, claiming he could eat no more. And each time Hank would rub his Piglet's belly, bemoaning how woefully thin he was getting, and so his Piglet would eat some more. And finally, three popped buttons later, all five plates had been consumed.

And just in time, too. Hank honestly wasn't sure how much more his Piglet could eat; the skin of his belly was stretched tight, and Hank believed that only Logan's healing factor would prevent the formation of stretch marks.

"Good piggy," he told his friend, caressing the obscenely stuffed belly and finding it hard as a rock. "Good, good piggy." His Piglet gave him a tired oink in response, lips quirked in a pained smile, his breaths shallow. Hank stood and helped Logan to his feet, throwing one arm around the smaller man's shoulder for support and possessively cupping his Piglet's bulging, overfed tummy with the other.

The journey was slow going as Hank led Logan towards the doctor's own room; his Piglet couldn't move very fast right now, what with his belly being so very, very full. By the time they reached the room Logan was leaning heavily against his Beast, his eyes heavily lidded as he fought off sleep. Hank smiled as they stepped inside, closing the door behind him.

"You can sleep here tonight, Logan. That is, if you don't mind?" His Piglet gave a tired grunt of affirmation.

"Don't mind at all, Beast. I'da passed out in the hall if it weren't for you." Hank shuddered slightly at his own pet name. It occurred to him that he should maybe find another; it would hardly do for him to react like that during a mission. But he'd ponder that later; right now, he was going to enjoy having his little Piglet all to himself. Gently he guided Logan over to the bed, letting the man lay down on his back as he pulled off his boots for him. That done he slid off the unbuttoned jeans before undoing the remaining buttons and collecting the shirt. That done, he shucked his own clothes and sat down on the bed, the king size mattress groaning under his greater weight.

"Well, now," he said with a slow smile. "you've certainly been a greedy little piggy, haven't you?" His Piglet's belly was so stuffed with food that it was bowed out into a half sphere even with the other man on his back. He leaned over, planting a gentle kiss to the slightly hairy flesh. "Would you say that's right, Piglet?" His Piglet nodded in response. Hank's grin widened. "Tell me what you are, Piglet."

"I'm a little piggy," Logan said, then gave a grunt of surprised pain as Hank pressed down hard on his swollen stomach, tutting in disapproval.

"Is that all you are, Piglet? I think you've forgotten something. Tell me what you are, Piglet?"

Logan took a moment to answer, his face twisting in discomfort as Hank slowly pressed down on his aching belly, the pressure making him feel as though he would pop. Then then answer came to him just as the discomfort started to become actual pain.

"I'm your little piggy, Beast." The pressure released instantaneously, his Beast smiling.

"Yes, you are, Piglet. You're my little piggy, and I'm going to fatten you up into a prize hog."

"Thought you were going to make me into a Beast?" His Piglet asked.

"Oh, you've got a long way to go before you reach Beast," Hank answered, flexing his biceps (still larger than Logan's own impressive ones), still visible under their thickening layer of fat. "A long way, indeed." He caressed his own belly, which even now that it was empty was still bigger than Logan's gorged one. "But don't worry, I'll help you get there eventually. But before you can become a Beast, you have to become a Hog." He slowly turned his Piglet onto his side and pulled him close, one arm wrapped around his chest, the other possessively cuddling the overfull tummy.

"You're going to get so fat, Piglet," he whispered, idly stroking the stuffed sphere. "I'm going to make you so plump, keep you so well-fed that your belly forgets what it feels like to be empty. Would you like that, Piglet?" Logan nodded slowly, eyes closed and almost asleep. Hank smiled, nuzzling his Piglet's hair. "I'd like that too, Piglet." Logan didn't answer this time, sleep having claimed him.

Hank lay awake for a few more minutes, enjoying holding his brand new Piglet in his arms as he planned the best ways to fatten him up. And of course he wouldn't be neglecting his own belly in this. The soft, flabby slab of furry flesh was currently squished up against his Piglet's back, pressing further against him with each slow, contented breath. It had long since finished digesting its meal, and he mentally told it to prepare for more such meals as it was now his personal goal to out-eat his little piggy at every turn; it wouldn't do to let his Piglet catch up to him, after all. What would Logan...what would Piglet...strive toward then?

Hank McCoy fell asleep, a contented smile on his face.

Thirty minutes later Hank wheeled the second of two tri-layer food carts into his room, each full to capacity with such delights as pancakes, sausages, bacon, eggs in a variety of styles, hashbrowns, biscuits, and gravy. One of the carts was a little overfull, actually, and he was looking forward to filling his belly with every last crumb of it. And part of his Piglet's, too.

Logan was awake when he entered the room this time, sitting up and rubbing his belly hungrily as he stared at the breakfast carts. "One a those for me?" He asked? Hank smiled, closing the door and walking over.

"It most certainly is," he said, chuckling when his Piglet licked his lips. "But first, stand up." Logan did so and Hank tsked, easily slipping back into the role of the concerned Beast. "My poor, poor Piglet," he said, shaking his head sadly. "Look at you." He cupped Logan's bulging belly in both hands, bouncing it gently up and down. "Last night's feeding didn't do you any good at all, did it?" Logan shook his head, cottoning on to the game as he looked down in mock sadness.

"Are you hungry, Piglet?" Hank asked, still gently bouncing the ball of fat in his hands.

Logan nodded.

"How hungry, Piglet?"

"Starving."

"I can see that," Hank replied. "Why, your tummy is shrinking by the second! I can feel it getting smaller right now!" His Piglet gave an alarmed oink, though his eyes were mischevious. "Well, there's a solution for that, isn't there Piglet?" Logan nodded, his belly rumbling with hunger. Hank smiled and stepped away, motioning towards the smaller of the two carts. "Have at it, then." His Piglet fell on the food, not even bothering with silverware as he tore into a stack of pancakes, shoving them two at a time into his greedy mouth. Hank watched for a moment, enjoying the sight of his Piglet stuffing himself again, before he turned towards his own cart, licking his lips and rubbing his large belly.

Deciding his Piglet had the right idea, Hank forewent silverware, simply using his fingers. The first thing he did was take a gravy boat and tip it towards his mouth, consuming the delicious liquid in a mere few seconds. Wiping his mouth, he turned his attention towards a dish of scrambled eggs. A few minutes later he set the now empty dish down, patting his belly as he reached for a plate overflowing with bacon.

The meal went on like this for sometime, Hank slowly and methodically working his way through the massive cart of food, his middle steadily swelling larger. About halfway through, though, he heard a pained grunt and a sad oink. Pausing in his eating, he turned towards the source of the sound and chuckled.

His precous little Piglet was laying back against the bed, clutching his belly in both hands. It had resumed the strained, swollen appearance of last night, and only three quarters of the cart was gone. His Piglet gave another grunt, looking at him and making a plaintive oink.

"What's wrong, Piglet?" He asked, knowing full well the problem. "Does your tummy hurt?"

"I feel...like I'm gonna....pop!" His Piglet gasped, breathing shallowly from the magnitude of the meal stuffed into his stomach. Hank chuckled and moved closer, prodding the bloated belly and prompting a surprised oink (the oinking surprised him; he would have thought that Logan would see such a thing as below his dignity. He was pleased that it wasn't, though; it was very fitting affectation for a man whose pet name was "Piglet").

"Well, well, Piglet, it seems as though you've stuffed yourself silly!" He gently massaged the stuffed ball. "Good piggy. Good, good piggy."

"But...what about...the rest?" Logan asked. Hank smiled benevolently.

"Oh, don't worry about that. I know just the place for it." He patted his belly meaningfully, and his Piglet grinned. Rising, he returned to his own cart and resumed eating. Logan watched him intently, and Hank smiled as he finished off his pancakes.

"Do you like watching Beast eat, Piglet? Like watching his belly swell with food?" His Piglet nodded, eyes rapt with attention. "Well, then keep watching. Because Beast is going to eat all of his own food, and yours, too!"

A part of him was tempted to tear into the meal with rabid frenzy, but he had no desire to share his Piglet's stomachache. Instead he continued his slow, methodical approach. He ignored the protesting of his stomach as he forced piece after piece of toast and bite after bite of sausage and egg down his throat, taking pleasure in the aching sides of his belly. He ignored his belly's pained gurgling as it struggled to digest the ever-increasing amount of food stuffed in it. By the time he finished off his own cart his stomach stood out in front of him like a beach ball, the sides bowed out with plenty. He chuckled as his Piglet stared in awe, his own breathing shallow. "Do you think you can move, Piglet?" He asked.

Logan tentatively shifted position, then gave an affirmative nod. Hank smiled.

"Good. Take the food from the cart and put it on the floor." His expression confused, Logan did as commanded, setting the dishes still to be eaten on the soft carpet. Hank smiled slyly, gently rubbing his stuffed belly.

Then, as his Piglet's eyes widened in delight, he got down on all fours. His stomach hanging heavily (and was that the faintest brush of carpet he felt?), he looked up at Logan. "Watch and learn, little Piglet."

And he buried his face in the food.

This time he did eat as though frenzied, his hungry mouth chomping and gobbling away at every scrap. He even licked a dish once he'd consumed its contents, determined to get every bit of food possible into his aching stomach. He even echoed his Piglet's oinks, suffusing them with an underlying growl to affirm his role as the Beast. Finally, after several minutes of rutting like a pig, every bite of food had been eaten and with a sigh Hank rolled over onto his back. His belly, stuffed and swollen and gorged with more food than ever before, jutted up like a mountain as he lay there panting shallowly. From the corner of his eye he saw his Piglet staring at him, eyes wide, his own overfed stomach forgotten. Laughing, Hank idly patted the drum-tight sphere on his torso.

"Do you like what you see, Piglet?" Logan nodded, gaze transfixed.

"Well, go on, then." His Piglet looked at him, confused, and so he clarified. "You can rub it, if you'd like." His Piglet was at his side in an instant and oh, even the slightest pressure on his stomach made him feel as though he'd explode, but it felt so good, and he sighed in contentment as his Piglet gave him a well-deserved belly rub. Folding his arms behind his head, Hank fell asleep to the gurgling sounds of his digesting meal and the loving caresses of his Piglet.

As Hank slept, his stomach bloated beyond imagination, he dreamed.

He was in a dark place, on his hands and knees, and he couldn't move. His belly, huge and more plump than ever, pressed against his thighs and onto the cool metal surface he rested on. His belly was stuffed like never before, and he felt as though he might pop with each labored breath. There was some sort of gag in his mouth preventing him from moving.

Suddenly, from beyond the darkness he heard familiar voice give a cry of delight. "Suckling pig, my favorite!" The cry was shortly followed by what sounded like muffled squeals of terror.

The darkness abruptly lifted, and horror flooded his mind as he stared into the grinning face of Fred Dukes, otherwise known as The Blob. It was not Blob that so frightened him, though, it was what he could see beyond him.

Logan, his beloved Piglet, was bound hands and knees onto a giant silver platter, an apple stuffed into his mouth. His belly hung fat and bloated below him (though nowhere near as large as his Beast's),his sides heaving as he hyperventilated.

Then his side was suddenly poked, and his huff of indignation was cut off as he realized that he was in the same position, bound to a platter with an apple stuck in his mouth.

"Mm-mm," Fred Dukes, said, setting aside the lid to the silver platter. "And roast beast, my favorite!" His belly was poked again as Blob licked his lips. "Nicely fattened, too!"

Hank awoke with a gasp, breathing heavily as he took in his surroundings. He was in his own room, not on a dinner tray for an appalling human being. More importantly, his Piglet was safe as well, cuddled up and holding his Beast's form like a teddy bear. Hank chuckled quietly and fondly stroked his Piglet's hair.

"Just a dream," he told himself quietly. "Only a dream."

He glanced idly towards where the breakfast carts (and the dishes from his feeding frenzy) had rested, pleasantly surprised to see them gone. Logan must have taken care of them while he slept. He would have to do something nice to show his appreciation.

But that was for later. Right now his stomach was still achingly (though not so achingly as before) stuffed full of food, his plump little Piglet was sleeping beside him, and it was a good three hours until lunch.

Hank McCoy fell back into the arms of sleep. And this time, dreamed only pleasant dreams.

"Woefully underfed though I am of late, my stomach can still hold a great deal. It will take considerable effort to, as you say 'fill me up good and stuffed.'"

"Ice cream should put some meat on Beast's bones, don'tcha think?" And without further ado Logan leaned over, plugged Hank's mouth with the funnel, and began the careful process of feeding his buddy melted ice cream.

Hank didn't have the right words to describe what he was feeling at the moment; he had always preferred his ice cream after it had had time to soften a bit, and this was just more of the same. The delicious vanilla flavor slid across his tongue like slightly thick milk as he just laid back and swallowed, sending every last extraordinarily fattening mouthful straight down into his eagerly-awaiting tummy. After about two minutes the stream of flavor stepped, and he couldn't resist a demanding whine around the funnel. He heard his Piglet let out a bark of laughter and felt the consoling pat on his belly. "Don't worry, Little Hank. There's plenty more where that came from.

Sure enough a stream of chocolate began to pour through the funnel, and Hank contentedly resumed his greedy suckling, feeling his belly beginning to fill, then overfill with the high-calorie fluid.

He counted at least three more flavors that he couldn't identify through the haze of his gluttony, and the more Hank's belly cried out for relief, the more greedily he swallowed. He wanted more! More! MORE!!!

Every tiny little motion set the obscenely bloated sphere to swaying majestically back and forth, and even the shallowest of breaths made Hank want to weep, feeling as though he would bust. 'Twelve gallons,' Hanks mind whispered. A part of him told him that shouldn't be physically possible, but the irrefutable evidence bulged up from his chubby torso, gurgling away in the slow process of digestion.

'Twelve gallons of ice cream,' his inner mathematician whispered as Piglet tentatively patted Hank's belly, rightfully afraid that too much pressure would pop his buddy. 'Average 4,320 calories per gallon, multiplied by twelve makes....51,840 calories!' Hank chuckled painfully, belly rolling like the ocean.

"You were...right on...both counts...Piglet." He wheezed. Logan cocked his head at him in confusion. Hank clarified with a pained smile.

"I certainly...won't be....moving for...the rest of the day. And this will...most assuredly..." He let his head fall back and closed his eyes, whispering the last bit with a delighted smile. "Plump me up."

121111211211111122.content:
Down in the holding cell, Fred Dukes listened to the sounds of the X-Men mobilizing, with a grin, stretching his massive form out as much as he could in the cramped cell as he settled down to wait.

He'd been in the cell for several weeks, now, but that was all right. The do-gooders didn't suspect a thing, and everything was going according to plan. One would wonder how the Blob, while trapped in a prison unable to see what was going on in the mansion, would know any plan, even his own was working.

The Blob knew because of his guards. Each day, a different member of the X-Men stood guard over him, and each time he saw them, they looked a little chubbier. Scott Summers could generously described as "husky" at this point, and Nightcrawler was outright stout. They were coming along nicely, but they were secondary concerns. The real prizes were Wolverine and Beast.

He'd seen the Wolverine most often out of all Xavier's little pets, and the Canadian was really plumping up. His flat abs had morphed into a potbelly that would make a Santa-In-Training proud, and he'd softened up in all the right places.

He was focusing his real efforts on Beast, though. As much as he hated Wolverine, at least the short mutant didn't go around acting like he was better than Blob just 'cause he was smarter. No, that was all Beast. His smug, condescending attitude had grated on Fred since the first time he met the fuzzball.

Well, he was going to have the last laugh. He had only seen the Beast a few times, and not for a few days now, but when last he saw the furball was fattening up nicely, with a belly approaching enormous proportions and a general level of chunkiness all over. Blob was glad he'd focused on Wolverine and the Beast.

They were going to be delicious.

Sure, Wolverine's metal skeleton might be a problem, but Blob was pretty sure his new and improved digestive system could handle it. It had handled his jerk-ass teammates, after all.

That was why no one had come to rescue them; he'd eaten them when his mutation had evolved. Swallowed them whole as soon as he realized he could. They'd deserved it for always making fun of him. And since it was catered to his specific X-gene, there was no way to test it any further except... "Well," he said aloud to no one, "for the betterment of the team, and for the furtherance of science..." He drank. And as the gene-enhancing formula rolled down his throat, he couldn't help but notice it tasted faintly of cranberries...

The moment the formula hit his belly, it began to spread a warmth throughout his entire body, rising to his chest, reaching out through his limbs, making his mind a bit fuzzy. The warmth built up into a heat that made him pant, supporting himself against the counter as his mind swam. He shuddered, or was that just his muscles spasming as the formula took hold? His large hand clenched, gouging the counter with his nails as his entire body seemed to flex all at once, every muscle suddenly taut and straining! He gritted his teeth as his whole body flexed even harder, bulging under his fur, making him groan. His body felt as if it were on fire, as if he'd spontaneously combust at any moment. His muscles bugled, pressing against each other and stretching his lab coat--that ever-present logical clinical part of his brain chided him for not having thought to take it off beforehand--fighting for a little more space with every passing second. It was hard for Hank to notice his body responding to the crowding by pulling him taller, wider, larger... He slid to his knees, arms limp before him, flexing helplessly again and again. He could feel his shoulders broadening, his neck thickening, his stomach... softening? How strange, while the rest of him bulged with muscle, his belly seemed to be pressing out into a decidedly rounder shape... not that he could focus on that for long! Bones creaked and stretched, finally causing him to howl and fall to the ground, dazed as the warmth finally started to recede...

When he finally recovered--minutes or hours, he had no idea--Hank slowly pulled himself up to his feet and peered down... to find that his feet were now a good thirteen inches further away than before! That, and he had to look past the significantly larger shelf of pectoral muscle that now bulged from his chest. He looked himself over slowly, feeling his thick neck flex with every movement. His lab coat's shoulder seams had split against his broader shoulders, so he simply reached up and tore off the sleeves. all the better to admire his bigger arms, flexing biceps that looked like they'd been replaced by medicine balls! Everything about him felt... big! Powerful! A grin spread across his face. "Initial results of the test seem to have been a rousing success..." His voice rumbled, a little deeper than before. "Now to see how the physical testing goes!"

Vaulting himself over the lab counters and landing with enough of a heavier thud than usual to nearly stumble him off-balance, Hank was paying close attention to the many differences in his overall weight distribution as he raced down the subterranian hallways to the Danger Room. He greeted Cyclops in passing, grinning a bit as the team leader's nonchalant response was choked off by a stunned look. Well, he'd have to expect to be getting a lot of those, now, wouldn't he? Locking himself into the Danger Room, Hank turned to the empty space. "Danger Room, activate training program Beta-Five, expert mode..."

"Compliance," called the gentle female voice from nowhere and everywhere. "Activating training program Beta-Five, expert mode in three, two, one..." That was as much warning as Hank got before the room suddenly leapt to life in an attempt to pound him into oblivion. Focused sound waves, pressurized air, and even entire sections of wall and ceiling buffetted him, attempting to knock him down and keep him down, but Hank could already feel the difference in how much more punishment his enhanced frame could take, the shockwaves barely budging him, the giant bludgeons unable to get close before he just punched them out of the way! Inside the Danger Room's viewing chamber, some of Hank's fellow X-Men watched.

"Is it just me, or does Hank seem... bigger, to you guys?" Cyclops was a bit unsure of this new development. While he trusted Hank's judgment, he could have at least discussed this with the rest of the team...

"Holy cow, guys! He just punched a hole in that reinforced wall! A hole! Haha! Go Hank!" Bobby danced about, nose practically pressed against the viewing chamber's windows as he watched the one-man-army pummel his way through a program that was designed to exhaust a whole team of participants.

"I don't like it, Cyke. Somethin' smells off about this. Since when do the X-men need performance enhancers, huh?" It was hard to tell whether Logan actually disapproved of the situation, or was maybe just jealous.

Down below, the training program finally had to give up, gears groaning and grinding as the Danger Room pulled itself back together. Hank stood in the middle of it, breathing hard, but not exhausted. Quite the opposite, this was a thrill! Adrenaline! The strength! The power! But just to ensure his comrades he was still himself, he turned to the viewing chamber and bowed gracefully. "It's all yours, gentlemen. But I'd give the room's auto-repair a little more time to recover, hm?" He strode out with a grin, heading for his room for some well-deserved rest. Oh yes, he could get used to this...
